title: Timorese Cultural Values and Urban Planning

questions.question: What is the central structure in traditional Timorese communities that serves as the spiritual and social center?
questions.answer: Uma lulik

questions.question: Which Timorese concept refers to clan-based hamlets or traditional settlements?
questions.answer: Knua

questions.question: What is the term for customary law in Timorese society?
questions.answer: Lisan

questions.question: Who are considered the spiritual land owners or custodians in Timorese tradition?
questions.answer: Rai na'in

questions.question: What is the traditional Timorese ritual for environmental protection and resource management?
questions.answer: Tara bandu

questions.question: Which term refers to the extended family networks in Timorese society?
questions.answer: Uma kain

questions.question: What is the role of lia nain in Timorese communities?
questions.answer: Traditional leaders

questions.question: In traditional Timorese settlements, what is typically at the center of spatial organization?
questions.answer: Uma lulik

questions.question: Which concept in Timorese culture distinguishes between sacred and profane spaces?
questions.answer: Lulik and Sau

questions.question: What is a key challenge in integrating cultural values into urban planning in Timor-Leste?
choices: Rapid pace of urbanization conflicting with traditional decision-making
questions.answer: Rapid pace of urbanization conflicting with traditional decision-making

questions.question: Which element of the uma lulik is believed to connect the earthly realm to the spiritual world?
questions.answer: The central post (kakuluk)

questions.question: What is the typical orientation of a traditional uma lulik?
questions.answer: East-West

questions.question: How can the concept of knua inform urban planning in Timor-Leste?
choices: By designing neighborhoods that foster strong community bonds
By eliminating all traditional elements from city design
By separating residential areas from commercial zones
questions.answer: By designing neighborhoods that foster strong community bonds

questions.question: What role can lisan play in urban governance structures?
choices: Be completely ignored in urban areas
Inform mechanisms for community consultation and dispute resolution
questions.answer: Inform mechanisms for community consultation and dispute resolution

questions.question: How might the concept of rai na'in be incorporated into urban land use planning?
choices: By ignoring all traditional land claims
By consulting spiritual leaders on matters of urban expansion
By only allowing foreign ownership of land
questions.answer: By consulting spiritual leaders on matters of urban expansion

questions.question: What is an example of how tara bandu principles could be applied in urban settings?
choices: Removing all green spaces from cities
questions.answer: Developing community-led environmental initiatives

questions.question: In the development of the Tasi Tolu area near Dili, what was a key consideration?
choices: Maximizing profit without regard for tradition
Respecting sacred sites and traditional land use patterns
questions.answer: Respecting sacred sites and traditional land use patterns

questions.question: What is a challenge in applying Timorese cultural values to urban planning across the country?
choices: Uniformity of customs across all regions
Diversity of cultural traditions across different regions
Universal agreement on all urban design principles
questions.answer: Diversity of cultural traditions across different regions

questions.question: What innovative approach are urban planners in Timor-Leste using to bridge traditional and modern practices?
choices: Completely abandoning all modern urban planning techniques
Using cultural mapping techniques to identify significant heritage sites
Building cities identical to Western models
questions.answer: Using cultural mapping techniques to identify significant heritage sites

questions.question: How can the uma lulik concept inspire modern urban design?
choices: By building sacred houses in every city block
By creating community centers that serve as focal points for cultural practices
By isolating communities from each other
questions.answer: By creating community centers that serve as focal points for cultural practices

questions.question: What is the significance of the elevated floor in traditional uma lulik design?
choices: It separates the sacred space from the profane ground
questions.answer: It separates the sacred space from the profane ground

questions.question: How does the knua model reflect Timorese social structure?
choices: It reflects social hierarchy and kinship structures
questions.answer: It reflects social hierarchy and kinship structures

questions.question: What aspect of lisan could be particularly relevant to urban resource management?
choices: Its promotion of rapid, uncontrolled development
questions.answer: Its mechanisms for conflict resolution

questions.question: How might acknowledging rai na'in affect urban expansion projects?
choices: It would have no effect on planning
It would lead to more culturally sensitive approaches to land use
It would prohibit all urban expansion
It would only allow foreign developers to build
questions.answer: It would lead to more culturally sensitive approaches to land use

questions.question: What is a potential urban application of tara bandu principles?
choices: Banning all traditional practices in cities
questions.answer: Developing sustainable waste management programs

questions.question: In Dili's urban development, how have traditional elements been incorporated?
choices: By incorporating traditional architectural elements into public buildings
By creating exact replicas of rural villages
questions.answer: By incorporating traditional architectural elements into public buildings

questions.question: What is a key consideration when adapting knua concepts to urban density?
choices: Completely abandoning the concept in cities
Building exact replicas of rural knua in urban areas
Balancing traditional spatial organization with urban space constraints
Ignoring all modern urban planning principles
questions.answer: Balancing traditional spatial organization with urban space constraints

questions.question: How can participatory planning processes incorporate Timorese cultural values?
choices: By excluding all community members from the process
By only consulting with foreign experts
By engaging elders and community leaders in the planning process
questions.answer: By engaging elders and community leaders in the planning process

questions.question: What role can cultural mapping play in urban planning in Timor-Leste?
choices: It can help identify significant heritage sites within urban areas
It is used to erase all cultural landmarks
It only focuses on modern developments
It is irrelevant to urban planning
questions.answer: It can help identify significant heritage sites within urban areas

questions.question: How might traditional Timorese concepts of gender-specific spaces be reinterpreted in modern urban design?
choices: By creating strict gender segregation in all public spaces
By designing flexible spaces that can accommodate both traditional and modern gender roles
questions.answer: By designing flexible spaces that can accommodate both traditional and modern gender roles
